issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: Fix up Hadoop POMs, roll up JARs to latest versions

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: hadoop-core has dependencies on two different versions of commons-httpclient
fields.environment: Seen on 0.20.205.0, but may be an issue for other versions of hadoop-core (and probably other hadoop builds)

comments.body:
Please see patch attached.

Functionally version 1.0 of the Maven enforcer plugin does not currently support dependency convergence. This patch upgrades the enforcer plugin to version 1.2 and enforces convergence on unique versions i.e Snapshot timestamps should also be enforced.

We need to be careful what we wish for, it didn't take long before particular libraries began to fail convergence

  against trunk revision .

Closing old tickets that are already part of a release.
